snippet: Officials from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention were not alarmed, urging Americans to continue to get flu shots, which they acknowledged were not completely effective.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention officials say deaths in current flu season have officially stepped into epidemic territory, but add there are early signs that caseloads could be peaking; urge Americans to get flu shots despite fact that they are only moderately effective.
lead_paragraph: Officials from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention were not alarmed, urging Americans to continue to get flu shots, which they acknowledged were not completely effective.

headline.seo: Flu Deaths Reach Epidemic Level, but May Be at Peak
headline.main: Flu Season Deaths Reach Epidemic Level but May Be at Peak, C.D.C. Says
headline.print_headline: Flu Season Deaths Reach Epidemic Level but May Be at Peak, C.D.C. Says

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
